alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Grant; Lincoln; Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 3:54AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Central, East Central, and North Central Washington, including the following counties, in Central Washington, Grant. In East Central Washington, Lincoln. In North Central Washington, Douglas and Okanogan. * WHEN...Until 700 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 353 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coulee Dam, Grand Coulee, Electric City, Mansfield, Sims Corner, Leahy, Mold, Bagdad Junction and Withrow. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
